body: Mhhhh and if i wanted to simulate this kind construction in THERM; what would be the material of choice? When I input the default air space resistance of honeybee i recieve the warning, that it has a conductivity of 0. Where it schould be something around 0.025 or 0.076921 according to this thread:  [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/therm-examp...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/therm-example?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1429638&xg_source=msg_com_gr_forum) But the custom made THERM material doesnt seem to be the right one either because as far as I understand it is only useful for windows constructions while setting the cavity model? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Gzb*D4mTQDX5s2*FUI*-N6yuzlMLj6X*jt1wDu19Ay6oWWQn5gPFjGQ2jtCB7*gOn59JTSyPUJtVHJ4SvR5NlHp0VENrYd0Z/Therm.PNG) Is there some way to set up a material for a ventilated air space as part of a rear ventilated facade? Best regards, Dominik
